Dialogue.content: Hi there, I'm Ella Thompson. This is my first time here.
Hello, Ella! It's great to meet you. How are you feeling today?
Honestly, I'm feeling a bit overwhelmed. I'm starting my third year of college, and it's just a lot to handle.
That sounds really challenging. Can you tell me more about what's been overwhelming you?
Well, I have a lot of pressure from my coursework in psychology, and my brother Mark is in med school, so I can't help but feel this pressure to succeed like him.
I understand. It can be tough to compare ourselves to others, especially family. It sounds like that comparison is adding to your stress. How does that make you feel?
It makes me feel insecure, like I'm not good enough.
Those feelings are valid, Ella. It's common to feel that way, especially when we have high expectations. What do you usually do to cope with those feelings?
I try to keep busy with my part-time job at a mental health outreach program, but it feels like it's adding to my stress.
Juggling school and work is a lot! It's important to find a balance. Have you considered taking some time for yourself?
I haven't really thought about it. I feel guilty for not working harder.
It's okay to give yourself a break, Ella. Taking care of your mental health is just as important as your studies. What do you enjoy doing that relaxes you?
I like photography and hiking, but I haven't had time for them lately.
How about scheduling some time to go for a hike or take some photos? It might help to clear your mind.
That sounds nice. I'll try to make time for that.
That's a great idea! Just remember to be kind to yourself. You're doing your best. Do you have any other thoughts you'd like to share today?
Not really, but this discussion has been helpful. Thank you for listening.
I'm glad to hear that, Ella. Remember, I'm here for you anytime you need to talk. Take care!
Hi, it's Ella again. I wanted to talk about something that happened recently.
Hi Ella! Of course, I'm here to listen. What's been on your mind?
I just came from a family gathering, and I felt really out of place. Everyone was celebrating Jason's soccer win, but I was just... lost.
Family gatherings can be a lot of pressure sometimes. What made you feel out of place?
My parents kept praising Mark for his success in med school. I couldn't help but feel inadequate compared to him.
That's tough, Ella. It's easy to slip into comparing ourselves to our siblings, especially when they're being highlighted. How did that make you feel?
I felt disconnected from my family. I was smiling and engaging with them, but inside, I was just... sad and frustrated.
It's okay to feel that way. You deserve to have your achievements acknowledged too. What do you think would help you express how you feel to your family?
I don't know. I fear that they won't understand.
It might help to have an open and honest conversation with them. They may be surprised to hear your perspective.
Yeah, maybe. It's just hard to open up about these feelings.
It can be difficult, but remember that vulnerability can lead to understanding. What are you thinking about doing next?
I think I need to process these feelings. Maybe I'll write them down.
That's a wonderful idea! Journaling can be therapeutic. If you ever want to share your thoughts, I'm here for you.
Thank you, that means a lot. I really appreciate this support.
You're welcome, Ella. Take care of yourself, and I look forward to hearing how you're doing next time.
Hi, I'm back. I've been thinking a lot about my work.
Hi Ella! I'm glad you're here. What's been on your mind?
I've been working at the outreach program and recently met a young woman named Sarah. She's really struggling with anxiety and depression.
That sounds like a really impactful experience. How did it affect you?
I tried to support her, but it was draining. I've started feeling helpless about my own emotional state.
That's understandable. Sometimes, supporting others can take a toll on our own wellbeing. Can you share more about what you've been feeling?
I feel exhausted, and it's like I'm withdrawing from friends and activities I used to enjoy.
It sounds like you're carrying a heavy emotional load. It's okay to step back and prioritize your own needs. What do you think might help you recharge?
I wish I could just escape from everything for a bit. But I also don't want to let Sarah down.
You're not letting anyone down by taking care of yourself first. It's important to preserve your own mental health. Have you considered talking to someone about these feelings?
Not really. I've been trying to handle it on my own.
It's okay to seek help. Sometimes, even a few sessions with a therapist can provide a fresh perspective. Would you be open to that?
I guess I could think about it. It just seems like a big step.
It can feel daunting, but it's a positive step forward. Remember, your wellbeing matters too.
Thank you, I appreciate your understanding. It helps to talk about this.
Of course! I'm here whenever you need support. Take care of yourself in the meantime.
Hi, it's Ella again. I had a discussion with my friend Mia last night.
Hi Ella! It's nice to see you back. How did that conversation go?
It was eye-opening. Mia encouraged me to confront my feelings and think about seeking professional help.
That's great to hear! Sharing your struggles with a friend can be so healing. How do you feel about her suggestion?
I feel a bit hopeful, but also scared about taking that step. What if it doesn't help?
It's completely normal to feel scared about seeking help. It's a big step, but remember, it's also a step toward healing. What about discussing your hesitations?
I worry I might not be taken seriously or that I won't connect with a therapist.
Those are valid concerns. Finding the right therapist can take time, but many are trained to be understanding and supportive. It's worth pursuing.
That makes sense. I do want to try to improve my situation.
That's an admirable goal! It shows strength to want to change. What other support do you think could help you as you consider this step?
I think I need to keep talking about it, maybe with more friends who understand.
Definitely! Having a support network can make a huge difference. You deserve to feel supported through this process.
Thank you for being here for me. I feel a bit lighter just talking about it.
I'm glad to hear that, Ella. Remember, I'm here whenever you need to talk. Take care and take your time with this journey.
